feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:18AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..Elevated Surf From Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow Through Monday Night... Southwest winds of 20 to 30 mph blowing over the Arctic Coast from Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow are causing elevated surf. These winds will continue into Monday, then turn northwest Monday afternoon, and decrease Monday night. These winds are causing
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:15AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf From The Bering Strait to Point Hope Starting Tonight... Northwest winds of 15 to 30 mph are expected to develop tonight over the southern Chukchi Sea, and to continue into Monday. This will cause elevated surf with minor beach erosion along the coast from the Bering Strait to Point Hope.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 11:44AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR MASSACHUSETTS... A dry airmass combined with severe to extreme drought conditions will result in elevated fire weather concerns today. RH values will drop to around 35 percent across Berkshire County this afternoon with northwest winds 10 to 15 mph with gusts to around 20 mph.

entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR MASSACHUSETTS... A dry airmass combined with severe to extreme drought conditions will result in elevated fire weather concerns today.
